Chapter 3.3:1: I am one who knows what it is to be punished by God.

Chapter 3.3:2: He drove me deeper and deeper into darkness

Chapter 3.3:3: And beat me again and again with merciless blows.

Chapter 3.3:4: He has left my flesh open and raw, and has broken my bones.

Chapter 3.3:5: He has shut me in a prison of misery and anguish.

Chapter 3.3:6: He has forced me to live in the stagnant darkness of death.

Chapter 3.3:7: He has bound me in chains; I am a prisoner with no hope of escape.

Chapter 3.3:8: I cry aloud for help, but God refuses to listen;

Chapter 3.3:9: I stagger as I walk; stone walls block me wherever I turn.

Chapter 3.3:10: He waited for me like a bear; he pounced on me like a lion.

Chapter 3.3:11: He chased me off the road, tore me to pieces, and left me.

Chapter 3.3:12: He drew his bow and made me the target for his arrows.

Chapter 3.3:13: He shot his arrows deep into my body.

Chapter 3.3:14: People laugh at me all day long; I am a joke to them all.

Chapter 3.3:15: Bitter suffering is all he has given me for food and drink.

Chapter 3.3:16: He rubbed my face in the ground and broke my teeth on rocks.

Chapter 3.3:17: I have forgotten what health and peace and happiness are.

Chapter 3.3:18: I do not have much longer to live; my hope in the Lord is gone.

Chapter 3.3:19: The thought of my pain, my homelessness, is bitter poison.

Chapter 3.3:20: I think of it constantly, and my spirit is depressed.

Chapter 3.3:21: Yet hope returns when I remember this one thing:

Chapter 3.3:22: The Lord's unfailing love and mercy still continue,

Chapter 3.3:23: Fresh as the morning, as sure as the sunrise.

Chapter 3.3:24: The Lord is all I have, and so in him I put my hope.

Chapter 3.3:25: The Lord is good to everyone who trusts in him,

Chapter 3.3:26: So it is best for us to wait in patience—to wait for him to save us—

Chapter 3.3:27: And it is best to learn this patience in our youth.

Chapter 3.3:28: When we suffer, we should sit alone in silent patience;

Chapter 3.3:29: We should bow in submission, for there may still be hope.

Chapter 3.3:30: Though beaten and insulted, we should accept it all.

Chapter 3.3:31: The Lord is merciful and will not reject us forever.

Chapter 3.3:32: He may bring us sorrow, but his love for us is sure and strong.

Chapter 3.3:33: He takes no pleasure in causing us grief or pain.

Chapter 3.3:34: The Lord knows when our spirits are crushed in prison;

Chapter 3.3:35: He knows when we are denied the rights he gave us;

Chapter 3.3:36: When justice is perverted in court, he knows.

Chapter 3.3:37: The will of the Lord alone is always carried out.

Chapter 3.3:38: Good and evil alike take place at his command.

Chapter 3.3:39: Why should we ever complain when we are punished for our sin?

Chapter 3.3:40: Let us examine our ways and turn back to the Lord.

Chapter 3.3:41: Let us open our hearts to God in heaven and pray,

Chapter 3.3:42: We have sinned and rebelled, and you, O Lord, have not forgiven us.

Chapter 3.3:43: You pursued us and killed us; your mercy was hidden by your anger,

Chapter 3.3:44: By a cloud of fury too thick for our prayers to get through.

Chapter 3.3:45: You have made us the garbage dump of the world.

Chapter 3.3:46: We are insulted and mocked by all our enemies.

Chapter 3.3:47: We have been through disaster and ruin; we live in danger and fear.

Chapter 3.3:48: My eyes flow with rivers of tears at the destruction of my people.

Chapter 3.3:49: My tears will pour out in a ceaseless stream

Chapter 3.3:50: Until the Lord looks down from heaven and sees us.

Chapter 3.3:51: My heart is grieved when I see what has happened to the women of the city.

Chapter 3.3:52: I was trapped like a bird by enemies who had no cause to hate me.

Chapter 3.3:53: They threw me alive into a pit and closed the opening with a stone.

Chapter 3.3:54: Water began to close over me, and I thought death was near.

Chapter 3.3:55: From the bottom of the pit, O Lord, I cried out to you,

Chapter 3.3:56: And when I begged you to listen to my cry, you heard.

Chapter 3.3:57: You answered me and told me not to be afraid.

Chapter 3.3:58: You came to my rescue, Lord, and saved my life.

Chapter 3.3:59: Judge in my favor; you know the wrongs done against me.

Chapter 3.3:60: You know how my enemies hate me and how they plot against me.

Chapter 3.3:61: You have heard them insult me, O Lord; you know all their plots.

Chapter 3.3:62: All day long they talk about me and make their plans.

Chapter 3.3:63: From morning till night they make fun of me.

Chapter 3.3:64: Punish them for what they have done, O Lord;

Chapter 3.3:65: Curse them and fill them with despair!

Chapter 3.3:66: Hunt them down and wipe them off the earth!
